This is the HTML code needed to properly display the media type

In sets, one set per line
Example for 'Software Version' field:
10=1.0
20=2.0
na=Not Applicable
Will produce:

10,20, or na stored in database. When showing field on download page, will use value from pair (20=2.0, shows '2.0')
If you choose a numeric field, then you may wish to search for entries that are greater or less than the search value.

This tool will create a .htaccess file in your images directory that will prevent your images from being hotlinked. Before running this tool you must first add some sites to the allowed list in the gallery settings.

This tool will scan your database and file system for broken or unlinked images and remove them (one directory at a time)
Scan and remove

This tool will attempt to read metadata (EXIF and IPTC) from your primary images and rebuild the database records with it
Scan and rebuild
This tool will recreate all the thumbnails and images in your gallery. This tool if useful if you have changed your image sizes or watermark, and now wish to rebuild your existing images
Selecting 'No' will copy the files instead of moving them

(Cannot create albums. Edit group to allow access.)
This action will remove all images contained in this album! Only proceed if you wish to permanently delete the contents of this album
A member album will be owned by the member you choose and can be public or private.
A global album can be uploaded into by any members that have permission to do so.
Force watermark on direct images but allow members to choose
This only applies to non-container albums. If 'yes' then the detail type (larger thumbnails) is used by default instead of the 'overview' mode (small cropped thumbnails)
Allow members to choose per album
Member albums cannot be in 'Root', you must select a parent album
Please note that the watermark option won't work at all until you specify a valid image in the settings!

The option 'Force watermark on direct images but allow members to choose' works only if the album is setup as 'Album only mode', if that option is disabled the result is the same as using 'Allow members to choose per album'.

When the option 'Force watermark' is chosen the album owner won't be able to disable anymore the watermark for new images.
Doesn't apply if the album is inside a global album that forces a watermark regardless
There are no albums to display.
